title: Build SkiaSharp for Win32 ARM64
body:
**Description of Change**

Build SkiaSharp for Win32 ARM64

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
**Testing**

Until CI is got all the other changes, you can install the NuGet packages from the preview feed: **2.80.0-preview.22**
Then use the binaries from the zip: [ARM64.zip](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/4838557/ARM64.zip)

> Preview feed: https://aka.ms/skiasharp-eap/index.json

This _should_ be working with all the other things, such as the WinForms/WPF views.

**Building**

If you want to build your own copy, no problem!

Just clone the repo (with submodules) and then run `.\bootstrapper.ps1 -t externals-windows --buildArch=arm64`

In the `./output/native/windows/ARM64/` directory, you will have a nice little bundle of files!

**TODO**

Once all the bits are built on CI, this should _just_ be a matter of installing the NuGets.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
All thanks to @snickler for testing this so quickly, I could merge this in to the v2.80 release! Thanks!

And just for show, here is a cool @AvaloniaUI app running with it:

![Avalon Studio on Windows ARM64](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1096616/85910498-7b477900-b81f-11ea-8ff3-f8d3ce1b6434.png)
